channel.title: Environmental variables
channel.description: Can someone send me their environmental variables cause I think I got mine wrong. I used the ones from the stormcutter tutorial but every complier i use seems to not find my jdk... My jdk is version 6 update 5.

item.title: Environmental variables
item.dc:creator: @aragorn246 aragorn246
item.description:
@aragorn246 wrote:

[quote=“uber leet, post:4, topic:220224”]When you use your java (log into any silabs server, this should get it activated) Look down near your digital clock in the bottom-right corner of your screen.

There should be some Icons there, one of thies icons is your java. Right click it and choose ‘Open Control Panel’ There should be an option there to ‘View version information about java control panel’ So click the ‘about’ button there, and a box should pop up.

This box will include you java version.

hope I’ve helped =D

Wetton[/quote]

tHANKS FOR YOUR HELP. But it didn’t work… sorry for caps.

Read full topic

item.title: Environmental variables
item.dc:creator: @uber_leet uber leet
item.description:
@uber_leet wrote:

When you use your java (log into any silabs server, this should get it activated) Look down near your digital clock in the bottom-right corner of your screen.

There should be some Icons there, one of thies icons is your java. Right click it and choose ‘Open Control Panel’ There should be an option there to ‘View version information about java control panel’ So click the ‘about’ button there, and a box should pop up.

This box will include you java version.

hope I’ve helped =D

Wetton

Read full topic

item.title: Environmental variables
item.dc:creator: @aragorn246 aragorn246
item.description:
@aragorn246 wrote:

How do you get into the java control panel?

Read full topic

item.title: Environmental variables
item.dc:creator: @uber_leet uber leet
item.description:
@uber_leet wrote:

I dont think this is your Enviromental Variables tbh. I think its more likely to be your compiler.

Right click your compiler and choose ‘Edit’

In the box that comes up, add the following:

@echo off
title (Your server name) COMPILER
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

Change the jdk1.6.0_07 to whatever version of java you have (This can be found in the Java control panel)

Hope thats helped,

Wetton.

Read full topic
